intro: Eurybia forsteri, commonly known as the New Zealand rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grey-green leaves. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming from late winter to early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal and alpine environments. Eurybia forsteri is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
